sen.e: By excluding the kanso nenbutsu (to contemplate Buddha [especially Amitabha] in the mind and repeat his name) and consolidating the Original Vow of Amida Buddha to invocation of the Buddha's name, Buddhism becomes open to commoners.

sen.j: 二門章では、道綽によって仏教を「聖道門」と「浄土門」に分ける。
sen.e: Nimonsho divides Buddhism into the 'Shodo-mon' (Gateway of the Holy Path) and the 'Jodo-mon' (Gateway of the Pure Land) according to Tao-cho's theory.

sen.e: It abolishes the 'Shodo-mon,' declares the independence of the Jodo Sect, designates three sutras and a thesis ('Jodo Sanbu-kyo' [The Three Pure Land Sutras] and "Muryoju-kyo ubataisha ganshoge") as their basis, and demonstrates that these concepts were instructed generation-to-generation from master to disciple by Donran, Tao-cho, Shandao and other masters.
